[http://www.math.uci.edu/~zhao/homepage/home/home.html Hong-Kai Zhao] | known_for = Level set method
Shock capturing methods
image | processing
L1/TV methods prizes = }} 'Stanley Osher' (born April 24, 1942) is an American mathematician, known for his many contributions in shock capturing, level set methods, and PDE-based methods in computer vision and image processing. Osher is a professor at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), Director of Special Projects in the Institute for Pure and Applied Mathematics (IPAM) and member of the California NanoSystems Institute (CNSI) at UCLA. He also has a daughter and a son, Kathryn and Joel, respectively.
